content.user_title: Manage Quality Systems and Regulatory Compliance
content.value_statement: Quality Managers in HealthTech and MedTech need comprehensive guidance for QMR responsibilities, regulatory compliance oversight, and strategic quality leadership. This skill provides frameworks for ISO 13485 compliance, FDA inspection readiness, and quality system governance.
actual_capabilities: Provides guidance on QMR responsibilities per ISO 13485 Clause 5.5.2 including quality system oversight and management accountability
Offers frameworks for multi-jurisdictional regulatory compliance including EU MDR 2017/745 and FDA QSR 21 CFR 820
Supports management review preparation and strategic quality planning with executive leadership
Delivers audit readiness frameworks for regulatory inspections and Notified Body audits
Provides quality KPI development and performance monitoring methodologies
Offers quality culture development and organizational quality leadership guidance
limitations: Does not replace the legal responsibilities of a designated QMR within an organization
Does not provide real-time regulatory intelligence or automatic updates on regulatory changes
Cannot execute regulatory submissions to authorities or physically audit facilities

use_cases.target_user: Quality assurance managers preparing for regulatory inspections
use_cases.title: Prepare for Regulatory Inspection
use_cases.description: Use when preparing HealthTech or MedTech organizations for FDA inspections, Notified Body audits, or authority reviews.

use_cases.title: Develop Quality Strategy
use_cases.description: Use when aligning quality management objectives with business strategy and regulatory requirements.

use_cases.target_user: QMRs and quality managers conducting management reviews
use_cases.title: Lead Management Review Meetings
use_cases.description: Use when preparing or conducting ISO 13485 Clause 5.6 management review meetings with executive teams.

prompt_templates.title: QMR Gap Assessment
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze our quality management system and identify gaps in QMR oversight responsibilities per ISO 13485 Clause 5.5.2. Focus on quality system effectiveness monitoring, regulatory compliance status, management reporting, and resource adequacy.

prompt_templates.title: Inspection Readiness
prompt_templates.prompt: Conduct a readiness assessment for our upcoming regulatory inspection. Our company operates in JURISDICTIONS and produces PRODUCT_TYPES. Identify key documentation, common findings, interview topics, and post-inspection procedures.

prompt_templates.title: Management Review Prep
prompt_templates.prompt: Help prepare a management review presentation for C-level executives including quality performance metrics, regulatory compliance status, customer satisfaction analysis, quality costs, and strategic initiatives.

prompt_templates.title: Quality Objectives
prompt_templates.prompt: Help develop quality objectives for our organization aligned with ISO 13485 requirements using SMART criteria with measurable targets and timelines.

output_examples.input: Help us prepare for an FDA inspection of our medical device manufacturing facility. What are the key focus areas?
output: FDA Inspection Readiness Framework: 1) Quality System Documentation - DHF, DMR, DHR completeness; 2) Common Focus Areas - CAPA, Design Controls, Production Controls; 3) Interview Preparation - procedures knowledge, CAPA flow understanding; 4) Post-Inspection Follow-Up - documentation, root cause, corrective actions

output_examples.input: Help me develop quality objectives for our organization that align with ISO 13485 requirements.
output: SMART Quality Objectives Framework: 1) QMS Effectiveness - 95% internal audit compliance rate; 2) Regulatory Compliance - zero critical findings; 3) Customer Satisfaction - 30-day complaint resolution; 4) Product Quality - 15% reduction in nonconformity rate YoY

best_practices: Integrate the QMR skill into regular quality management processes rather than using it only during audits or crises
Validate all regulatory compliance recommendations against current official regulatory guidance before implementation
Use the skill to prepare comprehensive documentation packages before management review meetings
anti_patterns: Using the skill to replace designated QMR responsibilities without proper human oversight and accountability
Implementing compliance recommendations without verifying against current official regulations
Relying solely on the skill for real-time regulatory intelligence instead of monitoring authoritative sources

faq.question: What is the difference between this QMR skill and having a human QMR?
faq.answer: This skill provides AI-assisted guidance on QMR responsibilities. It does not replace the legal designation of a QMR under EU MDR or FDA QSR. Use it as a support tool by or under supervision of your designated QMR.

faq.question: Can this skill help prepare for both FDA and EU MDR compliance?
faq.answer: Yes, it covers multi-jurisdictional compliance including FDA QSR 21 CFR 820, EU MDR 2017/745, and ISO 13485. Always verify specific requirements against current official guidance.

faq.question: How often should I use this skill for quality management?
faq.answer: Use it before management reviews for preparation, during audit preparation for readiness assessments, when developing quality strategy, and periodically for compliance gap analysis.

faq.question: Does this skill provide real-time regulatory updates?
faq.answer: No, it does not provide real-time regulatory intelligence. Monitor official regulatory authority sources for the latest updates and consult regulatory affairs professionals.

faq.question: What frameworks does this skill provide?
faq.answer: It provides frameworks for QMR responsibility matrices, regulatory compliance tracking, management review preparation, quality KPI development, and audit program oversight.

faq.question: Is this skill suitable for startup medical device companies?
faq.answer: Yes, it provides scalable guidance applicable to companies at any stage, from startups establishing their first quality management system to established manufacturers.
